MessageConsumerConfig

Consumer configuration

PropertyRequiredDescriptionDefault value
consumer.classnameOptionalThe name of concrete consumer classcom.inmobi.messaging.consumer.databus.DatabusConsumer
topic.nameOptonalThe topic from which messages should be read. If topic name is not set in the config, it can be passed from factory during consumer creation.
consumer.nameOptonalUnique name identifying the consumer. If consumer name is not set in the config, it can be passed from factory during consumer creation.-
consumer.statemitter.filenameOptionalThe configuration file for stat emitter. If nothing is passed, the stats will not emitted.-
messaging.consumer.chkpoint.provider.classnameOptionalThe checkpoint provider class name. It should extend com.inmobi.databus.CheckpointProvidercom.inmobi.databus.FSCheckpointProvider
messaging.consumer.checkpoint.dirOptionalThe path on which mark should store the checkpoint. This can be on Local filesystem or HDFS .(The current working directory)
messaging.consumer.buffer.sizeOptionalThe maximum number of messages consumer would read into buffer before they are processed.5000
messaging.consumer.principal.nameOptionalThe kerberos principal name of the consumer, if security is enabled on the clusters. If principal name is not set, commandline authentication will be used.-
messaging.consumer.keytab.pathOptionalThe path to the keytab file of the consumer, if security is enabled on the clusters. If keytab path is not set, commandline authentication will be used-
messaging.consumer.waittime.forfilecreateOptionalWait time in milli seconds for the consumer to check for new file creation1000
messaging.consumer.inputformat.classnameOptionalThe input format class name through which files should be read.For Databus Consumer: com.inmobi.messaging.consumer.databus.mapred.DatabusInputFormat For Hadoop Consumer: org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TextInputFormat
messaging.consumer.topic.retention.inhoursdeprectedThe retention period for the topic specified in hours-
messaging.consumer.absolute.starttimeOptionalStart time for the topic specified in the format ''yyyy/MM/dd/HH/mm'-
messaging.consumer.relative.starttime.inminutesOptionalThe relative time for the topic specified in minutes. To specify relative start time to go back.-
messaging.consumer.startofstreamOptionalSet this to true for starting from start of the streamfalse
messaging.consumer.absolute.stoptimeOptionalStop time for the topic specified in the format 'yyyy/MM/dd/HH/mm'-
messaging.consumer.read.localstreamOptionalThis allows user to reading from streams_local is optional incase CollectorStreamReader. Set this to false to disable reading streams_local incase CollecotrStreamreader.true
messaging.consumer.hadoop.confOptionalHadoop configuration file that can be used by the consumer-
messaging.consumer.group.membershipOptionalConsumerNumber in the consumer group. (consumerNumber/totalConsumers)1/1

DatabusConsumer configuraton properties

databus.consumer.rootdirsRequiredComma separated list of rootdirs of databus clusters from which messages should be consumed.-
databus.consumer.stream.typeOptionalDifferent stream types consumable. The supported types are COLLECTOR, LOCAL, MERGEDCOLLECTOR
databus.consumer.waittime.forcollectorflushOptionalWait time in milli seconds for consumer to read more messages, if the current file is being written. Applicable only for type COLLECTOR5000

HadoopConsumer configuration propertes

hadoop.consumer.rootdirsRequiredComma seperated list of prefix directories in Hadoop FileSystem from which messages should be read.
